4282     * sentence's length in words will be between minWords and maxWords, both inclusive, unless it would exceed
4283     * maxChars, in which case it is truncated. It will put one of the punctuation Strings from {@code midPunctuation}
4284     * between two words (before the space) at a frequency of {@code midPunctuationFrequency} (between 0 and 1), and
4285     * will end the sentence with one String chosen from {@code endPunctuation}.
4286     *
4287     * @param rng                     the RNG to use for the randomized string building
4288     * @param minWords                an int for the minimum number of words in a sentence; should be at least 1
4289     * @param maxWords                an int for the maximum number of words in a sentence; should be at least equal to minWords
4290     * @param midPunctuation          a String array where each element is a comma, semicolon, or the like that goes before a
4291     *                                space in the middle of a sentence
4292     * @param endPunctuation          a String array where each element is a period, question mark, or the like that goes at
4293     *                                the very end of a sentence
4294     * @param midPunctuationFrequency a double between 0.0 and 1.0 that determines how often Strings from
4295     *                                midPunctuation should be inserted before spaces
4296     * @param maxChars                the longest string length this can produce; should be at least {@code 6 * minWords}
4297     * @return a sentence in the fake language as a String
4298     */
4299    public String sentence(IRNG rng, int minWords, int maxWords, String[] midPunctuation, String[] endPunctuation,
4300                           double midPunctuationFrequency, int maxChars) {
4301        if(maxChars < 0)
4302            return sentence(rng, minWords, maxWords, midPunctuation, endPunctuation, midPunctuationFrequency);
4303        if (minWords < 1)
4304            minWords = 1;
4305        if (minWords > maxWords)
4306            maxWords = minWords;
4307        if (midPunctuationFrequency > 1.0) {
4308            midPunctuationFrequency = 1.0 / midPunctuationFrequency;
4309        }
4310        if (maxChars < 4)
4311            return "!";
4312        if (maxChars <= 5 * minWords) {
4313            minWords = 1;
4314            maxWords = 1;
4315        }
4316        int frustration = 0;
4317        ssb.setLength(0); 
4318        ssb.ensureCapacity(maxChars);
4319        String next = word(rng, true);
4320        while (next.length() >= maxChars - 1 && frustration < 50) {
4321            next = word(rng, true);
4322            frustration++;
4323        }
4324        if (frustration >= 50) return "!";
4325        ssb.append(next);
4326        for (int i = 1; i < minWords && ssb.length() < maxChars - 7; i++) {
4327            if (rng.nextDouble() < midPunctuationFrequency && ssb.length() < maxChars - 3) {
4328                ssb.append(rng.getRandomElement(midPunctuation));
4329            }
4330            next = word(rng, false);
4331            while (ssb.length() + next.length() >= maxChars - 2 && frustration < 50) {
4332                next = word(rng, false);
4333                frustration++;
4334            }
4335            if (frustration >= 50) break;
4336            ssb.append(' ').append(next);
4337        }
4338        for (int i = minWords; i < maxWords && ssb.length() < maxChars - 7 && rng.nextInt(2 * maxWords) > i && frustration < 50; i++) {
4339            if (rng.nextDouble() < midPunctuationFrequency && ssb.length() < maxChars - 3) {
4340                ssb.append(rng.getRandomElement(midPunctuation));
4341            }
4342            next = word(rng, false);
4343            while (ssb.length() + next.length() >= maxChars - 2 && frustration < 50) {
4344                next = word(rng, false);
4345                frustration++;
4346            }
4347            if (frustration >= 50) break;
4348            ssb.append(' ');
4349            ssb.append(next);
4350        }
4351
4352        if (endPunctuation != null && endPunctuation.length > 0) {
4353
4354            next = rng.getRandomElement(endPunctuation);
4355            if (ssb.length() + next.length() >= maxChars)
4356                ssb.append('.');
4357            else
4358                ssb.append(next);
4359        }
4360
4361        if (ssb.length() > maxChars)
4362            return "!";
4363        return ssb.toString();
4364    }
4365
4366    protected String[] merge1000(IRNG rng, String[] me, String[] other, double otherInfluence) {
4367        if (other.length <= 0 && me.length <= 0)
4368            return new String[]{};
4369        String[] ret = new String[1000];
4370        int otherCount = (int) (1000 * otherInfluence);
4371        int idx = 0;
4372        if (other.length > 0) {
4373            String[] tmp = new String[other.length];
4374            rng.shuffle(other, tmp);
4375            for (idx = 0; idx < otherCount; idx++) {
4376                ret[idx] = tmp[idx % tmp.length];
4377            }
4378        }
4379        if (me.length > 0) {
4380            String[] tmp = new String[me.length];
4381            rng.shuffle(me, tmp);
4382            for (; idx < 1000; idx++) {
4383                ret[idx] = tmp[idx % tmp.length];
4384            }
4385        } else {
4386            for (; idx < 1000; idx++) {
4387                ret[idx] = other[idx % other.length];
4388            }
4389        }
4390        return ret;
4391    }

4394    protected static String[] accentVowels(IRNG rng, String[] me, double influence) {
4395        String[] ret = new String[1000];
4396        int otherCount = (int) (1000 * influence);
4397        int idx;
4398        Matcher matcher;
4399        if (me.length > 0) {
4400            String[] tmp = new String[me.length];
4401            rng.shuffle(me, tmp);
4402            for (idx = 0; idx < otherCount; idx++) {
4403                ret[idx] = tmp[idx % tmp.length]
4404                        .replace('a', accentedVowels[0][rng.nextInt(accentedVowels[0].length)])
4405                        .replace('e', accentedVowels[1][rng.nextInt(accentedVowels[1].length)])
4406                        .replace('i', accentedVowels[2][rng.nextInt(accentedVowels[2].length)])
4407                        .replace('o', accentedVowels[3][rng.nextInt(accentedVowels[3].length)])
4408                        .replace('u', accentedVowels[4][rng.nextInt(accentedVowels[4].length)]);
4409                matcher = repeats.matcher(ret[idx]);
4410                if (matcher.find()) {
4411                    ret[idx] = matcher.replaceAll(rng.getRandomElement(me));
4412                }
4413            }
4414            for (; idx < 1000; idx++) {
4415                ret[idx] = tmp[idx % tmp.length];
4416            }
4417        } else
4418            return new String[]{};
4419        return ret;
4420    }

4558    /**
4559     * Makes a new FakeLanguageGen that mixes this object with {@code other}, mingling the consonants and vowels they
4560     * use as well as any word suffixes or other traits, and favoring the qualities in {@code other} by
4561     * {@code otherInfluence}, which will value both languages evenly if it is 0.5 . 
4562     * <br>
4563     * You should generally prefer {@link #mix(double, FakeLanguageGen, double, Object...)} or
4564     * {@link #mixAll(Object...)} if you ever mix 3 or more languages. Chaining this mix() method can be very
4565     * counter-intuitive because the weights are relative, while in the other mix() and mixAll() they are absolute.
4566     * @param other another FakeLanguageGen to mix along with this one into a new language
4567     * @param otherInfluence how much other should affect the pair, with 0.5 being equal and 1.0 being only other used
4568     * @return a new FakeLanguageGen with traits from both languages
4569     */
4570    public FakeLanguageGen mix(FakeLanguageGen other, double otherInfluence) {
4571        otherInfluence = Math.max(0.0, Math.min(otherInfluence, 1.0));
4572        double myInfluence = 1.0 - otherInfluence;
4573
4574        GWTRNG rng = new GWTRNG(hashCode(), other.hashCode() ^ NumberTools.doubleToMixedIntBits(otherInfluence));
4575
4576        String[] ov = merge1000(rng, openingVowels, other.openingVowels, otherInfluence),
4577                mv = merge1000(rng, midVowels, other.midVowels, otherInfluence),
4578                oc = merge1000(rng, openingConsonants, other.openingConsonants, otherInfluence *
4579                        Math.max(0.0, Math.min(1.0, 1.0 - other.vowelStartFrequency + vowelStartFrequency))),
4580                mc = merge1000(rng, midConsonants, other.midConsonants, otherInfluence),
4581                cc = merge1000(rng, closingConsonants, other.closingConsonants, otherInfluence *
4582                        Math.max(0.0, Math.min(1.0, 1.0 - other.vowelEndFrequency + vowelEndFrequency))),
4583                cs = merge1000(rng, closingSyllables, other.closingSyllables, otherInfluence *
4584                        Math.max(0.0, Math.min(1.0, other.syllableEndFrequency - syllableEndFrequency))),
4585                splitters = merge1000(rng, vowelSplitters, other.vowelSplitters, otherInfluence);
4586
4587        double[] fr = new double[Math.max(syllableFrequencies.length, other.syllableFrequencies.length)];
4588        System.arraycopy(syllableFrequencies, 0, fr, 0, syllableFrequencies.length);
4589        for (int i = 0; i < other.syllableFrequencies.length; i++) {
4590            fr[i] += other.syllableFrequencies[i];
4591        }
4592        ArrayList<Modifier> mods = new ArrayList<>(modifiers.size() + other.modifiers.size());
4593        mods.addAll(modifiers);
4594        mods.addAll(other.modifiers);
4595        return new FakeLanguageGen(ov, mv, oc, mc, cc, cs, splitters, fr,
4596                vowelStartFrequency * myInfluence + other.vowelStartFrequency * otherInfluence,
4597                vowelEndFrequency * myInfluence + other.vowelEndFrequency * otherInfluence,
4598                vowelSplitFrequency * myInfluence + other.vowelSplitFrequency * otherInfluence,
4599                syllableEndFrequency * myInfluence + other.syllableEndFrequency * otherInfluence,
4600                (sanityChecks == null) ? other.sanityChecks : sanityChecks, true, mods)
4601                .setName(otherInfluence > 0.5 ? other.name + "/" + name : name + "/" + other.name);
4602    }
4603
4604    private static double readDouble(Object o) {
4605        if (o instanceof Double) return (Double) o;
4606        else if (o instanceof Float) return (Float) o;
4607        else if (o instanceof Long) return ((Long) o).doubleValue();
4608        else if (o instanceof Integer) return (Integer) o;
4609        else if (o instanceof Short) return (Short) o;
4610        else if (o instanceof Byte) return (Byte) o;
4611        else if (o instanceof Character) return (Character) o;
4612        return 0.0;
4613    }
4614
4615    /**
4616     * Produces a FakeLanguageGen by mixing this FakeLanguageGen with one or more other FakeLanguageGen objects. Takes
4617     * a weight for this, another FakeLanguageGen, a weight for that FakeLanguageGen, then a possibly-empty group of
4618     * FakeLanguageGen parameters and the weights for those parameters. If other1 is null or if pairs has been given a
4619     * value of null instead of the normal (possibly empty) array of Objects, then this simply returns a copy of this
4620     * FakeLanguageGen. Otherwise, it will at least mix this language with other1 using the given weights for each.
4621     * If pairs is not empty, it has special requirements for what types it allows and in what order, but does no type
4622     * checking. Specifically, pairs requires the first Object to be a FakeLanguageGen, the next to be a number of some
4623     * kind that will be the weight for the previous FakeLanguageGen(this method can handle non-Double weights, and
4624     * converts them to Double if needed), and every two parameters after that to follow the same order and pattern
4625     * (FakeLanguageGen, then number, then FakeLanguageGen, then number...). Weights are absolute, and don't depend on
4626     * earlier weights, which is the case when chaining the {@link #mix(FakeLanguageGen, double)} method. This makes
4627     * reasoning about the ideal weights for multiple mixed languages easier; to mix 3 languages equally you can use
4628     * 3 equal weights with this, whereas with mix chaining you would need to mix the first two with 0.5 and the third
4629     * with 0.33 .
4630     * <br>
4631     * It's up to you whether you want to use {@link #mixAll(Object...)} or this method; they call the same code and
4632     * produce the same result, including the summary for serialization support. You probably shouldn't use
4633     * {@link #mix(FakeLanguageGen, double)} with two arguments in new code, since it's easy to make mistakes when
4634     * mixing three or more languages (calling that twice or more).
4635     *
4636     * @param myWeight the weight to assign this FakeLanguageGen in the mix
4637     * @param other1   another FakeLanguageGen to mix in; if null, this method will abort and return {@link #copy()}
4638     * @param weight1  the weight to assign other1 in the mix
4639     * @param pairs    may be empty, not null; otherwise must alternate between FakeLanguageGen and number (weight) elements
4640     * @return a FakeLanguageGen produced by mixing this with any FakeLanguageGen arguments by the given weights
4641     */
4642    public FakeLanguageGen mix(double myWeight, FakeLanguageGen other1, double weight1, Object... pairs) {
4643        if (other1 == null || pairs == null)
4644            return copy();
4645        OrderedSet<Modifier> mods = new OrderedSet<>(modifiers);
4646        FakeLanguageGen mixer = removeModifiers();
4647        FakeLanguageGen[] languages = new FakeLanguageGen[2 + (pairs.length >>> 1)];
4648        double[] weights = new double[languages.length];
4649        String[] summaries = new String[languages.length];
4650        boolean summarize = true;
4651        double total = 0.0, current, weight;
4652        languages[0] = mixer;
4653        total += weights[0] = myWeight;
4654        if ((summaries[0] = mixer.summary) == null) summarize = false;
4655        mods.addAll(other1.modifiers);
4656        languages[1] = other1.removeModifiers();
4657        total += weights[1] = weight1;
4658        if (summarize && (summaries[1] = languages[1].summary) == null) summarize = false;
4659        for (int i = 1, p = 2; i < pairs.length; i += 2, p++) {
4660            if (pairs[i] == null || pairs[i - 1] == null)
4661                continue;
4662            languages[p] = ((FakeLanguageGen) pairs[i - 1]).removeModifiers();
4663            total += weights[p] = readDouble(pairs[i]);
4664            if (summarize && (summaries[p] = languages[p].summary) == null) summarize = false;
4665        }
4666        if (total == 0)
4667            return copy();
4668        current = myWeight / total;
4669        for (int i = 1; i < languages.length; i++) {
4670            if ((weight = weights[i]) > 0)
4671                mixer = mixer.mix(languages[i], weight / total / (current += weight / total));
4672        }
4673        if (summarize) {
4674            sb.setLength(0);
4675            String c;
4676            int idx;
4677            for (int i = 0; i < summaries.length; i++) {
4678                c = summaries[i];
4679                idx = c.indexOf('@');
4680                if (idx >= 0) {
4681                    sb.append(c, 0, idx + 1).append(weights[i]);
4682                    if (i < summaries.length - 1)
4683                        sb.append('~');
4684                }
4685            }
4686            for (int i = 0; i < mods.size(); i++) {
4687                sb.append('℗').append(mods.getAt(i).serializeToString());
4688            }
4689            return mixer.addModifiers(mods).summarize(sb.toString());
4690        } else
4691            return mixer.addModifiers(mods);
4692    }
4693
4694    /**
4695     * Produces a FakeLanguageGen from a group of FakeLanguageGen parameters and the weights for those parameters.
4696     * Requires the first Object in pairs to be a FakeLanguageGen, the next to be a number of some kind that will be the
4697     * weight for the previous FakeLanguageGen(this method can handle non-Double weights, and converts them to Double
4698     * if needed), and every two parameters after that to follow the same order and pattern (FakeLanguageGen, then
4699     * number, then FakeLanguageGen, then number...). There should be at least 4 elements in pairs, half of them
4700     * languages and half of them weights, for this to do any mixing, but it can produce a result with as little as one
4701     * FakeLanguageGen (returning a copy of the first FakeLanguageGen). Weights are absolute, and don't depend on
4702     * earlier weights, which is the case when chaining the {@link #mix(FakeLanguageGen, double)} method. This makes
4703     * reasoning about the ideal weights for multiple mixed languages easier; to mix 3 languages equally you can use
4704     * 3 equal weights with this, whereas with mix chaining you would need to mix the first two with 0.5 and the third
4705     * with 0.33 .
4706     * <br>
4707     * This is probably the most intuitive way to mix languages here, though there's also
4708     * {@link #mix(double, FakeLanguageGen, double, Object...)}, which is very similar but doesn't take its parameters
4709     * in quite the same way (it isn't static, and treats the FakeLanguageGen object like the first item in pairs here).
4710     * Used internally in the deserialization code.
4711     *
4712     * @param pairs should have at least one item, and must alternate between FakeLanguageGen and number (weight) elements
4713     * @return a FakeLanguageGen produced by mixing any FakeLanguageGen arguments by the given weights
4714     */
4715    public static FakeLanguageGen mixAll(Object... pairs) {
4716        int len;
4717        if (pairs == null || (len = pairs.length) <= 0)
4718            return ENGLISH.copy();
4719        if (len < 4)
4720            return ((FakeLanguageGen) pairs[0]).copy();
4721        Object[] pairs2 = new Object[len - 4];
4722        if (len > 4)
4723            System.arraycopy(pairs, 4, pairs2, 0, len - 4);
4724        return ((FakeLanguageGen) pairs[0]).mix(readDouble(pairs[1]), (FakeLanguageGen) pairs[2], readDouble(pairs[3]), pairs2);
4725    }
4726
4727    /**
4728     * Produces a new FakeLanguageGen like this one but with extra vowels and/or consonants possible, adding from a wide
4729     * selection of accented vowels (if vowelInfluence is above 0.0) and/or consonants (if consonantInfluence is above
4730     * 0.0). This may produce a gibberish-looking language with no rhyme or reason to the accents, and generally
4731     * consonantInfluence should be very low if it is above 0 at all.
4732     * @param vowelInfluence between 0.0 and 1.0; if 0.0 will not affect vowels at all
4733     * @param consonantInfluence between 0.0 and 1.0; if 0.0 will not affect consonants at all
4734     * @return a new FakeLanguageGen with modifications to add accented vowels and/or consonants
4735     */
4736    public FakeLanguageGen addAccents(double vowelInfluence, double consonantInfluence) {
4737        vowelInfluence = Math.max(0.0, Math.min(vowelInfluence, 1.0));
4738        consonantInfluence = Math.max(0.0, Math.min(consonantInfluence, 1.0));
4739        GWTRNG rng = new GWTRNG(hashCode(),
4740                NumberTools.doubleToMixedIntBits(vowelInfluence)
4741                        ^ NumberTools.doubleToMixedIntBits(consonantInfluence));
4742        String[] ov = accentVowels(rng, openingVowels, vowelInfluence),
4743                mv = accentVowels(rng, midVowels, vowelInfluence),
4744                oc = accentConsonants(rng, openingConsonants, consonantInfluence),
4745                mc = accentConsonants(rng, midConsonants, consonantInfluence),
4746                cc = accentConsonants(rng, closingConsonants, consonantInfluence),
4747                cs = accentBoth(rng, closingSyllables, vowelInfluence, consonantInfluence);
4748
4749
4750        return new FakeLanguageGen(ov, mv, oc, mc, cc, cs, vowelSplitters, syllableFrequencies,
4751                vowelStartFrequency,
4752                vowelEndFrequency,
4753                vowelSplitFrequency,
4754                syllableEndFrequency, sanityChecks, clean, modifiers).setName(name + "-Bònüs");
4755    }
4756
4757    private static String[] copyStrings(String[] start) {
4758        String[] next = new String[start.length];
4759        System.arraycopy(start, 0, next, 0, start.length);
4760        return next;
4761    }
4762
4763    /**
4764     * Useful for cases with limited fonts, this produces a new FakeLanguageGen like this one but with all accented
4765     * characters removed (including almost all non-ASCII Latin-alphabet characters, but only some Greek and Cyrillic
4766     * characters). This will replace letters like "A with a ring" with just "A". Some of the letters chosen as
4767     * replacements aren't exact matches.
4768     * @return a new FakeLanguageGen like this one but without accented letters
4769     */
4770    public FakeLanguageGen removeAccents() {
4771
4772        String[] ov = copyStrings(openingVowels),
4773                mv = copyStrings(midVowels),
4774                oc = copyStrings(openingConsonants),
4775                mc = copyStrings(midConsonants),
4776                cc = copyStrings(closingConsonants),
4777                cs = copyStrings(closingSyllables);
4778        for (int i = 0; i < ov.length; i++) {
4779            ov[i] = removeAccents(openingVowels[i]).toString();
4780        }
4781        for (int i = 0; i < mv.length; i++) {
4782            mv[i] = removeAccents(midVowels[i]).toString();
4783        }
4784        for (int i = 0; i < oc.length; i++) {
4785            oc[i] = removeAccents(openingConsonants[i]).toString();
4786        }
4787        for (int i = 0; i < mc.length; i++) {
4788            mc[i] = removeAccents(midConsonants[i]).toString();
4789        }
4790        for (int i = 0; i < cc.length; i++) {
4791            cc[i] = removeAccents(closingConsonants[i]).toString();
4792        }
4793        for (int i = 0; i < cs.length; i++) {
4794            cs[i] = removeAccents(closingSyllables[i]).toString();
4795        }
4796
4797        return new FakeLanguageGen(ov, mv, oc, mc, cc, cs, vowelSplitters, syllableFrequencies,
4798                vowelStartFrequency,
4799                vowelEndFrequency,
4800                vowelSplitFrequency,
4801                syllableEndFrequency, sanityChecks, clean, modifiers);
4802    }

4807     * produce a String like "English/French" (or "English/French/Maori" if more are mixed together). If no name was
4808     * registered, this will return "Nameless Language".
4809     * @return the human-readable name of this language, or "Nameless Language" if none is known
4810     */

4812        return name;

4879    @Override
4880    public boolean equals(Object o) {
4881        if (this == o) return true;
4882        if (o == null || getClass() != o.getClass()) return false;
4883
4884        FakeLanguageGen that = (FakeLanguageGen) o;
4885
4886        if (clean != that.clean) return false;
4887        if (Double.compare(that.totalSyllableFrequency, totalSyllableFrequency) != 0) return false;
4888        if (Double.compare(that.vowelStartFrequency, vowelStartFrequency) != 0) return false;
4889        if (Double.compare(that.vowelEndFrequency, vowelEndFrequency) != 0) return false;
4890        if (Double.compare(that.vowelSplitFrequency, vowelSplitFrequency) != 0) return false;
4891        if (Double.compare(that.syllableEndFrequency, syllableEndFrequency) != 0) return false;
4892        // Probably incorrect - comparing Object[] arrays with Arrays.equals
4893        if (!Arrays.equals(openingVowels, that.openingVowels)) return false;
4894        // Probably incorrect - comparing Object[] arrays with Arrays.equals
4895        if (!Arrays.equals(midVowels, that.midVowels)) return false;
4896        // Probably incorrect - comparing Object[] arrays with Arrays.equals
4897        if (!Arrays.equals(openingConsonants, that.openingConsonants)) return false;
4898        // Probably incorrect - comparing Object[] arrays with Arrays.equals
4899        if (!Arrays.equals(midConsonants, that.midConsonants)) return false;
4900        // Probably incorrect - comparing Object[] arrays with Arrays.equals
4901        if (!Arrays.equals(closingConsonants, that.closingConsonants)) return false;
4902        // Probably incorrect - comparing Object[] arrays with Arrays.equals
4903        if (!Arrays.equals(vowelSplitters, that.vowelSplitters)) return false;
4904        // Probably incorrect - comparing Object[] arrays with Arrays.equals
4905        if (!Arrays.equals(closingSyllables, that.closingSyllables)) return false;
4906        if (!Arrays.equals(syllableFrequencies, that.syllableFrequencies)) return false;
4907        // Probably incorrect - comparing Object[] arrays with Arrays.equals
4908        if (!Arrays.equals(sanityChecks, that.sanityChecks)) return false;
4909        return modifiers != null ? modifiers.equals(that.modifiers) : that.modifiers == null;
4910    }
4911
4912    @Override
4913    public int hashCode() {
4914        int result = 31 * 31 * 31 * 31 +
4915                31 * 31 * 31 * CrossHash.hash(openingVowels) +
4916                31 * 31 * CrossHash.hash(midVowels) +
4917                31 * CrossHash.hash(openingConsonants) +
4918                CrossHash.hash(midConsonants) | 0;
4919        result = 31 * 31 * 31 * 31 * result +
4920                31 * 31 * 31 * CrossHash.hash(closingConsonants) +
4921                31 * 31 * CrossHash.hash(vowelSplitters) +
4922                31 * CrossHash.hash(closingSyllables) ^
4923                (clean ? 1 : 0);
4924        result = 31 * 31 * 31 * 31 * result +
4925                31 * 31 * 31 * CrossHash.hash(syllableFrequencies) +
4926                31 * 31 * NumberTools.doubleToMixedIntBits(totalSyllableFrequency) +
4927                31 * NumberTools.doubleToMixedIntBits(vowelStartFrequency) +
4928                NumberTools.doubleToMixedIntBits(vowelEndFrequency) | 0;
4929        result = 31 * 31 * 31 * 31 * result +
4930                31 * 31 * 31 * (sanityChecks != null ? sanityChecks.length + 1 : 0) +
4931                31 * 31 * NumberTools.doubleToMixedIntBits(syllableEndFrequency) +                 
4932                31 * NumberTools.doubleToMixedIntBits(vowelSplitFrequency) | 0;
4933        if(modifiers != null) {
4934            for (int i = 0; i < modifiers.size(); i++) {
4935                result = result + 7 * (i + 1) * modifiers.get(i).hashCode() | 0;
4936            }
4937        }
4938        return result;
4939    }
4940    public long hash64() {
4941        long result           = CrossHash.hash64(openingVowels);
4942        result = 31L * result + CrossHash.hash64(midVowels);
4943        result = 31L * result + CrossHash.hash64(openingConsonants);
4944        result = 31L * result + CrossHash.hash64(midConsonants);
4945        result = 31L * result + CrossHash.hash64(closingConsonants);
4946        result = 31L * result + CrossHash.hash64(vowelSplitters);
4947        result = 31L * result + CrossHash.hash64(closingSyllables);
4948        result = 31L * result + CrossHash.hash64(syllableFrequencies);
4949        result = 31L * result + (clean ? 1L : 0L);
4950        result = 31L * result + NumberTools.doubleToLongBits(totalSyllableFrequency);
4951        result = 31L * result + NumberTools.doubleToLongBits(vowelStartFrequency);
4952        result = 31L * result + NumberTools.doubleToLongBits(vowelEndFrequency);
4953        result = 31L * result + NumberTools.doubleToLongBits(vowelSplitFrequency);
4954        result = 31L * result + NumberTools.doubleToLongBits(syllableEndFrequency);
4955        result = 31L * result + (sanityChecks != null ? sanityChecks.length + 1L : 0L);
4956        result *= 31L;
4957        if(modifiers != null) {
4958            for (int i = 0; i < modifiers.size(); i++) {
4959                result += 7L * (i + 1L) * CrossHash.hash64(modifiers.get(i).alterations);
4960            }
4961        }
4962        return result;
4963    }

4998
4999    public static FakeLanguageGen deserializeFromString(String data) {
5000        if (data == null || data.equals(""))
5001            return ENGLISH.copy();
5002        int poundIndex = data.indexOf('#'), snailIndex = data.indexOf('@'), tempBreak = data.indexOf('℗'),
5003                breakIndex = (tempBreak < 0) ? data.length() : tempBreak,
5004                tildeIndex = Math.min(data.indexOf('~'), breakIndex), prevTildeIndex = -1;
5005        if (tildeIndex < 0)
5006            tildeIndex = data.length();
5007
5008        if (snailIndex < 0)
5009            return ENGLISH.copy();
5010        ArrayList<Object> pairs = new ArrayList<>(4);
5011        while (snailIndex >= 0) {
5012            if (poundIndex >= 0 && poundIndex < snailIndex) // random case
5013            {
5014                pairs.add(randomLanguage(Long.parseLong(data.substring(poundIndex + 1, snailIndex))));
5015                pairs.add(Double.valueOf(data.substring(snailIndex + 1, tildeIndex)));
5016                poundIndex = -1;
5017            } else {
5018                pairs.add(registry.getAt(Integer.parseInt(data.substring(prevTildeIndex + 1, snailIndex))));
5019                pairs.add(Double.valueOf(data.substring(snailIndex + 1, tildeIndex)));
5020            }
5021            snailIndex = data.indexOf('@', snailIndex + 1);
5022            if (snailIndex > breakIndex)
5023                break;
5024            prevTildeIndex = tildeIndex;
5025            tildeIndex = Math.min(data.indexOf('~', tildeIndex + 1), breakIndex);
5026            if (tildeIndex < 0)
5027                tildeIndex = data.length();
5028        }
5029        ArrayList<Modifier> mods = new ArrayList<>(8);
5030        if (breakIndex == tempBreak) {
5031            tildeIndex = breakIndex - 1;
5032            while ((prevTildeIndex = data.indexOf('℗', tildeIndex + 1)) >= 0) {
5033                tildeIndex = data.indexOf('℗', prevTildeIndex + 1);
5034                if (tildeIndex < 0) tildeIndex = data.length();
5035                mods.add(Modifier.deserializeFromString(data.substring(prevTildeIndex, tildeIndex)));
5036            }
5037        }
5038        FakeLanguageGen flg = mixAll(pairs.toArray());
5039        flg.modifiers.addAll(mods);
5040        return flg;
5041    }
5042
5043    public static class Modifier implements Serializable {
5044        private static final long serialVersionUID = 1734863678490422371L;
5045        private transient static final StringBuilder modSB = new StringBuilder(32);
5046        public final Alteration[] alterations;
5047
5048        public Modifier() {
5049            alterations = new Alteration[0];
5050        }
5051
5052        public Modifier(String pattern, String replacement) {
5053            alterations = new Alteration[]{new Alteration(pattern, replacement)};
5054        }
5055
5056        public Modifier(String pattern, String replacement, double chance) {
5057            alterations = new Alteration[]{new Alteration(pattern, replacement, chance)};
5058        }
5059
5060        public Modifier(Alteration... alts) {
5061            alterations = (alts == null) ? new Alteration[0] : alts;
5062        }
5063
5064        public StringBuilder modify(IRNG rng, StringBuilder sb) {
5065            Matcher m;
5066            Replacer.StringBuilderBuffer tb;
5067            boolean found;
5068            Alteration alt;
5069            for (int a = 0; a < alterations.length; a++) {
5070                alt = alterations[a];
5071                modSB.setLength(0);
5072                tb = Replacer.wrap(modSB);
5073                m = alt.replacer.getPattern().matcher(sb);
5074
5075                found = false;
5076                while (true) {
5077                    if (alt.chance >= 1 || rng.nextDouble() < alt.chance) {
5078                        if (!Replacer.replaceStep(m, alt.replacer.getSubstitution(), tb))
5079                            break;
5080                        found = true;
5081                    } else {
5082                        if (!m.find())
5083                            break;
5084                        found = true;
5085                        m.getGroup(MatchResult.PREFIX, tb);
5086                        m.getGroup(MatchResult.MATCH, tb);
5087                        m.setTarget(m, MatchResult.SUFFIX);
5088                    }
5089                }
5090                if (found) {
5091                    m.getGroup(MatchResult.TARGET, tb);
5092                    sb.setLength(0);
5093                    sb.append(modSB);
5094                }
5095            }
5096            return sb;
5097        }
5098
5099        /**
5100         * For a character who always pronounces 's', 'ss', and 'sh' as 'th'.
5101         */
5102        public static final Modifier LISP = new Modifier("[tţťț]?[sśŝşšș]+h?", "th");
5103
5104        /**
5105         * For a character who always lengthens 's' and 'z' sounds not starting a word.
5106         */
5107        public static final Modifier HISS = new Modifier("(.)([sśŝşšșzźżž])+", "$1$2$2$2");
5108
5109        /**
5110         * For a character who has a 20% chance to repeat a starting consonant or vowel.
5111         */
5112        public static final Modifier STUTTER = new Modifier(
5113                new Alteration("^([^aàáâãäåæāăąǻǽeèéêëēĕėęěiìíîïĩīĭįıoòóôõöøōŏőœǿuùúûüũūŭůűųyýÿŷỳαοειυωаеёийъыэюяоу]+)", "$1-$1", 0.2),
5114                new Alteration("^([aàáâãäåæāăąǻǽeèéêëēĕėęěiìíîïĩīĭįıoòóôõöøōŏőœǿuùúûüũūŭůűųαοειυωаеёийъыэюяоу]+)", "$1-$1", 0.2));
5115
5116        /**
5117         * For a language that has a 40% chance to repeat a single Latin vowel (a, e, o, or a variant on one of them
5118         * like å or ö, but not merged letters like æ and œ).
5119         */
5120        public static final Modifier DOUBLE_VOWELS = new Modifier(
5121                "([^aàáâãäåæāăąǻǽeèéêëēĕėęěiìíîïĩīĭįıoòóôõöøōŏőœǿuùúûüũūŭůűųyýÿŷỳ]|^)"
5122                        + "([aàáâãäåāăąǻeèéêëēĕėęěòóôõöøōŏőǿ])"
5123                        + "([^aàáâãäåæāăąǻǽeèéêëēĕėęěiìíîïĩīĭįıoòóôõöøōŏőœǿuùúûüũūŭůűųyýÿŷỳ]|$)", "$1$2$2$3", 0.4);
5124

5126        /**
5127         * For a language that has a 50% chance to repeat a single consonant.
5128         */
5129        public static final Modifier DOUBLE_CONSONANTS = new Modifier("([aàáâãäåæāăąǻǽeèéêëēĕėęěiìíîïĩīĭįıoòóôõöøōŏőœǿuùúûüũūŭůűųyýÿŷỳαοειυωаеёийъыэюяоу])" +
5130                "([^aàáâãäåæāăąǻǽeèéêëēĕėęěiìíîïĩīĭįıoòóôõöøōŏőœǿuùúûüũūŭůűųyýÿŷỳαοειυωаеёийъыэюяоуqwhjx])" +

5133        /**
5134         * For a language that never repeats the same letter twice in a row.
5135         */
5136        public static final Modifier NO_DOUBLES = new Modifier("(.)\\1", "$1");

5138        /**
5139         * Removes accented letters and the two non-English consonants from text generated with {@link #NORSE}.
5140         * Replaces á, é, í, ý, ó, æ, ú, and ö with a, e, i, y, o, ae, and ou. In some instances, replaces j
5141         * with y. Replaces ð and þ with th and th, except for when preceded by s (then it replaces sð or sþ
5142         * with st or st) or when the start of a word is fð or fþ, where it replaces with fr or fr.
5143         */
5144        public static final Modifier SIMPLIFY_NORSE = replacementTable(
5145                "á", "a",
5146                "é", "e",
5147                "í", "i",
5148                "ý", "y",
5149                "ó", "o",
5150                "ú", "u",
5151                "æ", "ae",
5152                "ö", "ou",
5153                "([^aeiou])jy", "$1yai",
5154                "([^aeiou])j(?:[aeiouy]+)", "$1yo",
5155                "s([ðþ])", "st",
5156                "\\bf[ðþ]", "fr",
5157                "[ðþ]", "th");
5158
5159        /**
5160         * Simple changes to merge "ae" into "æ", "oe" into "œ", and any of "aé", "áe", or "áé" into "ǽ".
5161         */
5162        public static final Modifier LIGATURES = replacementTable("ae", "æ", "oe", "œ", "áe", "ǽ", "aé", "ǽ", "áé", "ǽ");
5163
5164        /**
5165         * Simple changes to merge "æ" into "ae", "œ" into "oe", and "ǽ" into "áe".
5166         */
5167        public static final Modifier SPLIT_LIGATURES = replacementTable("æ", "ae", "œ", "oe", "ǽ", "áe");
5168        /**
5169         * Some changes that can be applied when sanity checks (which force re-generating a new word) aren't appropriate
5170         * for fixing a word that isn't pronounceable.
5171         */
5172        public static final Modifier GENERAL_CLEANUP = replacementTable(
5173                "[æǽœìíîïĩīĭįıiùúûüũūŭůűųuýÿŷỳy]([æǽœýÿŷỳy])", "$1",
5174                "q([ùúûüũūŭůűųu])$", "q$1e",
5175                "([ìíîïĩīĭįıi])[ìíîïĩīĭįıi]", "$1",
5176                "([æǽœìíîïĩīĭįıiùúûüũūŭůűųuýÿŷỳy])[wŵẁẃẅ]$", "$1",
5177                "([ùúûüũūŭůűųu])([òóôõöøōŏőǿo])", "$2$1",
5178                "[àáâãäåāăąǻaèéêëēĕėęěeìíîïĩīĭįıiòóôõöøōŏőǿoùúûüũūŭůűųuýÿŷỳy]([æǽœ])", "$1",
5179                "([æǽœ])[àáâãäåāăąǻaèéêëēĕėęěeìíîïĩīĭįıiòóôõöøōŏőǿoùúûüũūŭůűųuýÿŷỳy]", "$1",
5180                "([wŵẁẃẅ])[wŵẁẃẅ]", "$1",
5181                "qq", "q");
5182
5183        //àáâãäåāăąǻæǽaèéêëēĕėęěeìíîïĩīĭįıiòóôõöøōŏőœǿoùúûüũūŭůűųuýÿŷỳy
5184        //bcçćĉċčdþðďđfgĝğġģhĥħjĵȷkķlĺļľŀłmnñńņňŋpqrŕŗřsśŝşšștţťțvwŵẁẃẅxyýÿŷỳzźżž
5185
5186        /**
5187         * Creates a Modifier that will replace the nth char in initial with the nth char in change. Expects initial and
5188         * change to be the same length, but will use the lesser length if they are not equal-length. Because of the
5189         * state of the text at the time modifiers are run, only lower-case letters need to be searched for.
5190         *
5191         * @param initial a String containing lower-case letters or other symbols to be swapped out of a text
5192         * @param change  a String containing characters that will replace occurrences of characters in initial
5193         * @return a Modifier that can be added to a FakeLanguageGen with its addModifiers() method
5194         */
5195        public static Modifier charReplacementTable(String initial, String change) {
5196            Alteration[] alts = new Alteration[Math.min(initial.length(), change.length())];
5197            for (int i = 0; i < alts.length; i++) {
5198                //literal string syntax; avoids sensitive escaping issues and also doesn't need a character class,
5199                // which is slightly slower and has some odd escaping cases.
5200                alts[i] = new Alteration("\\Q" + initial.charAt(i), change.substring(i, i + 1));
5201            }
5202            return new Modifier(alts);
5203        }
5204
5205        /**
5206         * Creates a Modifier that will replace the nth String key in map with the nth value. Because of the
5207         * state of the text at the time modifiers are run, only lower-case letters need to be searched for.
5208         * This overload of replacementTable allows full regex pattern strings as keys and replacement syntax,
5209         * such as searching for "([aeiou])\\1+" to find repeated occurrences of the same vowel, and "$1" in
5210         * this example to replace the repeated section with only the first vowel.
5211         * The ordering of map matters if a later key contains an earlier key (the earlier one will be replaced
5212         * first, possibly making the later key not match), or if an earlier replacement causes a later one to
5213         * become valid.
5214         *
5215         * @param map containing String keys to replace and String values to use instead; replacements happen in order
5216         * @return a Modifier that can be added to a FakeLanguageGen with its addModifiers() method
5217         */
5218        public static Modifier replacementTable(OrderedMap<String, String> map) {
5219            if (map == null)
5220                return new Modifier();
5221            Alteration[] alts = new Alteration[map.size()];
5222            for (int i = 0; i < alts.length; i++) {
5223                alts[i] = new Alteration(map.keyAt(i), map.getAt(i));
5224            }
5225            return new Modifier(alts);
5226        }
5227
5228        /**
5229         * Creates a Modifier that will replace the (n*2)th String in pairs with the (n*2+1)th value in pairs. Because
5230         * of the state of the text at the time modifiers are run, only lower-case letters need to be searched for.
5231         * This overload of replacementTable allows full regex syntax for search and replacement Strings,
5232         * such as searching for "([aeiou])\\1+" to find repeated occurrences of the same vowel, and "$1" in
5233         * this example to replace the repeated section with only the first vowel.
5234         * The ordering of pairs matters if a later search contains an earlier search (the earlier one will be replaced
5235         * first, possibly making the later search not match), or if an earlier replacement causes a later one to
5236         * become valid.
5237         *
5238         * @param pairs array or vararg of alternating Strings to search for and Strings to replace with; replacements happen in order
5239         * @return a Modifier that can be added to a FakeLanguageGen with its addModifiers() method
5240         */
5241        public static Modifier replacementTable(String... pairs) {
5242            int len;
5243            if (pairs == null || (len = pairs.length) <= 1)
5244                return new Modifier();
5245            Alteration[] alts = new Alteration[len >> 1];
5246            for (int i = 0; i < alts.length; i++) {
5247                alts[i] = new Alteration(pairs[i<< 1], pairs[i<<1|1]);
5248            }
5249            return new Modifier(alts);
5250        }

5254         * language already uses; insertion will replace an existing vowel (at any point in a word that had a vowel
5255         * generated) with a probability of {@code chance}, so chance should be low (0.1 at most) unless you want the
5256         * newly-inserted vowel to be likely to be present in every word of some sentences.

5259         * @return a Modifier that can be added to a FakeLanguageGen with its addModifiers() method
5260         */

5370

5389        public String serializeToString() {
5390            if (alterations.length == 0) return "\6";
5391            modSB.setLength(0);
5392            modSB.append('\6');
5393            for (int i = 0; i < alterations.length; i++)
5394                modSB.append(alterations[i].serializeToString()).append('\6');
5395            return modSB.toString();
5396        }
5397
5398        public static Modifier deserializeFromString(String data) {
5399            int currIdx = data.indexOf(6), altIdx = currIdx, matches = 0;
5400            while (currIdx >= 0) {
5401                if ((currIdx = data.indexOf(6, currIdx + 1)) < 0)
5402                    break;
5403                matches++;
5404            }
5405            Alteration[] alts = new Alteration[matches];
5406            for (int i = 0; i < matches; i++) {
5407                alts[i] = Alteration.deserializeFromString(data.substring(altIdx + 1, altIdx = data.indexOf(6, altIdx + 1)));
5408            }
5409            return new Modifier(alts);
5410        }
5411    }
5412
5413    public static class Alteration implements Serializable {
5414        private static final long serialVersionUID = -2138854697837563188L;
5415        public Replacer replacer;
5416        public String replacement;
5417        public double chance;
5418
5419        public Alteration() {
5420            this("[tţťț]?[sśŝşšș]+h?", "th");
5421        }
5422
5423        public Alteration(String pattern, String replacement) {
5424            this.replacement = replacement;
5425            replacer = Pattern.compile(pattern).replacer(replacement);
5426            chance = 1.0;
5427        }
5428
5429        public Alteration(String pattern, String replacement, double chance) {
5430            this.replacement = replacement;
5431            replacer = Pattern.compile(pattern).replacer(replacement);
5432            this.chance = chance;
5433        }
5434
5435        public Alteration(Pattern pattern, String replacement, double chance) {
5436            this.replacement = replacement;
5437            replacer = pattern.replacer(replacement);
5438            this.chance = chance;
5439        }
5440
5441        @Override
5442        public boolean equals(Object o) {
5443            if (this == o) return true;
5444            if (o == null || getClass() != o.getClass()) return false;
5445
5446            Alteration that = (Alteration) o;
5447
5448            if (Double.compare(that.chance, chance) != 0) return false;
5449            return replacer.equals(that.replacer);
5450
5451        }
5452
5453        @Override
5454        public int hashCode() {
5455            long result;
5456            result = CrossHash.hash64(replacer.getPattern().serializeToString());
5457            result = 31L * result + NumberTools.doubleToLongBits(chance);
5458            result ^= result >>> 32;
5459            return (int) (0xFFFFFFFFL & result);
5460        }
5461
5462        @Override
5463        public String toString() {
5464            return "Alteration{" +
5465                    "replacer=" + replacer +
5466                    ", chance=" + chance +
5467                    '}';
5468        }
5469
5470        public String serializeToString() {
5471            return replacer.getPattern().serializeToString() + '\2' + replacement + '\4' + chance;
5472        }
5473
5474        public static Alteration deserializeFromString(String data) {
5475            int split2 = data.indexOf('\2'), split4 = data.indexOf('\4');
5476            return new Alteration(Pattern.deserializeFromString(data.substring(0, split2)),
5477                    data.substring(split2 + 1, split4),
5478                    Double.parseDouble(data.substring(split4 + 1)));
5479        }
5480    }

5482    /**
5483     * A simple way to bundle a FakeLanguageGen with the arguments that would be passed to it when calling
5484     * {@link FakeLanguageGen#sentence(IRNG, int, int, String[], String[], double, int)} or one of its overloads.
5485     * You can call {@link #sentence()} on this to produce another String sentence with the parameters it was given
5486     * at construction. The parameters to
5487     * {@link #SentenceForm(FakeLanguageGen, IStatefulRNG, int, int, String[], String[], double, int)} are stored in fields of
5488     * the same name, and all fields in this class are public and modifiable.
5489     */
5490    public static class SentenceForm implements Serializable
5491    {
5492        private static final long serialVersionUID = 1246527948419533147L;
5493        public IStatefulRNG rng;
5494        public int minWords, maxWords, maxChars;
5495        public String[] midPunctuation, endPunctuation;
5496        public double midPunctuationFrequency;
5497        public FakeLanguageGen language;
5498
5499        /**
5500         * Builds a SentenceForm with all default fields, using {@link FakeLanguageGen#FANTASY_NAME} for a language,
5501         * using between 1 and 9 words in a sentence, and otherwise defaulting to how
5502         * {@link #SentenceForm(FakeLanguageGen, int, int)} behaves.
5503         */
5504        public SentenceForm()
5505        {
5506            this(FakeLanguageGen.FANTASY_NAME, FakeLanguageGen.srng, 1, 9,
5507                    mid,
5508                    end, 0.18, -1);
5509        }
5510        /**
5511         * Builds a SentenceForm with only a few fields specified. The {@link #rng} will be made based on
5512         * FakeLanguageGen's static {@link FakeLanguageGen#srng} field, maxChars will be -1 so the sentence length
5513         * will be limited only by maxWords and the length of words produced, and the between-word and end-of-sentence
5514         * punctuation will be set to reasonable defaults. This places either a comma or a semicolon after a word in the
5515         * middle of a sentence about 18% of the time ({@code midPunctuationFrequency} is 0.18), and can end a sentence
5516         * in a period, exclamation mark, question mark, or ellipsis (the "..." punctuation).
5517         * @param language A FakeLanguageGen to use to generate words
5518         * @param minWords minimum words per sentence
5519         * @param maxWords maximum words per sentence
5520         */
5521        public SentenceForm(FakeLanguageGen language, int minWords, int maxWords)
5522        {
5523            this(language, FakeLanguageGen.srng, minWords, maxWords, mid,
5524                    end, 0.18, -1);
5525        }
5526        /**
5527         * Builds a SentenceForm with all fields specified except for {@link #rng}, which will be made based on
5528         * FakeLanguageGen's static {@link FakeLanguageGen#srng} field, and maxChars, which means the sentence length
5529         * will be limited only by maxWords and the length of words produced.
5530         * @param language A FakeLanguageGen to use to generate words
5531         * @param minWords minimum words per sentence
5532         * @param maxWords maximum words per sentence
5533         * @param midPunctuation an array of Strings that can be used immediately after words in the middle of sentences, like "," or ";"
5534         * @param endPunctuation an array of Strings that can end a sentence, like ".", "?", or "..."
5535         * @param midPunctuationFrequency the probability that two words will be separated by a String from midPunctuation, between 0.0 and 1.0
5536         */
5537        public SentenceForm(FakeLanguageGen language, int minWords, int maxWords, String[] midPunctuation,
5538                            String[] endPunctuation, double midPunctuationFrequency)
5539        {
5540            this(language, FakeLanguageGen.srng, minWords, maxWords, midPunctuation, endPunctuation,
5541                    midPunctuationFrequency, -1);
5542        }
5543        /**
5544         * Builds a SentenceForm with all fields specified except for {@link #rng}, which will be made based on
5545         * FakeLanguageGen's static {@link FakeLanguageGen#srng} field.
5546         * @param language A FakeLanguageGen to use to generate words
5547         * @param minWords minimum words per sentence
5548         * @param maxWords maximum words per sentence
5549         * @param midPunctuation an array of Strings that can be used immediately after words in the middle of sentences, like "," or ";"
5550         * @param endPunctuation an array of Strings that can end a sentence, like ".", "?", or "..."
5551         * @param midPunctuationFrequency the probability that two words will be separated by a String from midPunctuation, between 0.0 and 1.0
5552         * @param maxChars the maximum number of chars to use in a sentence, or -1 for no hard limit
5553         */
5554        public SentenceForm(FakeLanguageGen language, int minWords, int maxWords, String[] midPunctuation,
5555                            String[] endPunctuation, double midPunctuationFrequency, int maxChars)
5556        {
5557            this(language, FakeLanguageGen.srng, minWords, maxWords, midPunctuation, endPunctuation,
5558                    midPunctuationFrequency, maxChars);
5559        }
5560
5561        /**
5562         * Builds a SentenceForm with all fields specified; each value is referenced directly except for {@code rng},
5563         * which will not change or be directly referenced (a new GWTRNG will be used with the same state value).
5564         * @param language A FakeLanguageGen to use to generate words
5565         * @param rng a StatefulRNG that will not be directly referenced; the state will be copied into a new StatefulRNG
5566         * @param minWords minimum words per sentence
5567         * @param maxWords maximum words per sentence
5568         * @param midPunctuation an array of Strings that can be used immediately after words in the middle of sentences, like "," or ";"
5569         * @param endPunctuation an array of Strings that can end a sentence, like ".", "?", or "..."
5570         * @param midPunctuationFrequency the probability that two words will be separated by a String from midPunctuation, between 0.0 and 1.0
5571         * @param maxChars the maximum number of chars to use in a sentence, or -1 for no hard limit
5572         */
5573        public SentenceForm(FakeLanguageGen language, IStatefulRNG rng, int minWords, int maxWords,
5574                            String[] midPunctuation, String[] endPunctuation,
5575                            double midPunctuationFrequency, int maxChars)
5576        {
5577            this.language = language;
5578            this.rng = new GWTRNG(rng.getState());
5579            this.minWords = minWords;
5580            this.maxWords = maxWords;
5581            this.midPunctuation = midPunctuation;
5582            this.endPunctuation = endPunctuation;
5583            this.midPunctuationFrequency = midPunctuationFrequency;
5584            this.maxChars = maxChars;
5585        }
5586        public String sentence()
5587        {
5588            return language.sentence(rng, minWords, maxWords, midPunctuation, endPunctuation,
5589                    midPunctuationFrequency, maxChars);
5590        }
5591
5592        public String serializeToString() {
5593            return language.serializeToString() + '℘' +
5594                    rng.getState() + '℘' +
5595                    minWords + '℘' +
5596                    maxWords + '℘' +
5597                    StringKit.join("ℙ", midPunctuation) + '℘' +
5598                    StringKit.join("ℙ", endPunctuation) + '℘' +
5599                    NumberTools.doubleToLongBits(midPunctuationFrequency) + '℘' +
5600                    maxChars;
5601        }
5602        public static SentenceForm deserializeFromString(String ser)
5603        {
5604            int gap = ser.indexOf('℘');
5605            FakeLanguageGen lang = FakeLanguageGen.deserializeFromString(ser.substring(0, gap));
5606            GWTRNG rng = new GWTRNG(
5607                    StringKit.longFromDec(ser,gap + 1, gap = ser.indexOf('℘', gap + 1)));
5608            int minWords = StringKit.intFromDec(ser,gap + 1, gap = ser.indexOf('℘', gap + 1));
5609            int maxWords = StringKit.intFromDec(ser,gap + 1, gap = ser.indexOf('℘', gap + 1));
5610            String[] midPunctuation =
5611                    StringKit.split(ser.substring(gap + 1, gap = ser.indexOf('℘', gap + 1)), "ℙ");
5612            String[] endPunctuation =
5613                    StringKit.split(ser.substring(gap + 1, gap = ser.indexOf('℘', gap + 1)), "ℙ");
5614            double midFreq = NumberTools.longBitsToDouble(StringKit.longFromDec(ser,gap + 1, gap = ser.indexOf('℘', gap + 1)));
5615            int maxChars = StringKit.intFromDec(ser,gap + 1, ser.length());
5616            return new SentenceForm(lang, rng, minWords, maxWords, midPunctuation, endPunctuation, midFreq, maxChars);
5617        }
5618    }
5619}
